SEARCH
Package antcolony.environment

Class ColorScheme

java.lang.Object
antcolony.environment.ColorScheme
public class ColorScheme extends Object
Manager for simulation colors and visual environment.

This class centralizes all color definitions. It is responsible for: 1. Defining seasonal palettes (Spring, Summer, etc.). 2. Calculating the day/night cycle (sky color interpolation). 3. Defining colors for ants and colonies.

  • Method Details

    • updateSeasonalColors

      public void updateSeasonalColors(processing.core.PApplet p, AntColonySimulation sim)
      Updates the global color palette based on the current season.

      Should be called whenever the season changes or at simulation startup.

      Parameters:
      p - Reference to PApplet.
      sim - Reference to the simulation (to determine the current season).

    • getAntColor

      public int getAntColor(int colonyId, boolean hasFood)
      Obtains the correct color for an ant based on its colony and state.
      Parameters:
      colonyId - ID of the colony (0 or 1).
      hasFood - Whether the ant is carrying food (lighter color).
      Returns:
      The color as an integer value.

    • getTargetLeafColor

      public int getTargetLeafColor(processing.core.PApplet p, int s)
      Defines leaf colors for each season.

    • getTargetGround

      public int getTargetGround(processing.core.PApplet p, int s)
      Defines ground colors for each season.

    • getSkyColor

      public int getSkyColor(processing.core.PApplet p, AntColonySimulation sim)
      Calculates sky color based on the time of day. Performs linear interpolation (lerp) between Night, Dawn, Day, and Dusk.
      Parameters:
      p - Reference to PApplet.
      sim - Reference to the simulation (for time data).
      Returns:
      Current sky color.

    • calculateTreeColor

      public int calculateTreeColor(processing.core.PApplet p, AntColonySimulation sim, float offset)
      Calculates a color variation for an individual tree. Ensures not all trees have the exact same color.
      Parameters:
      p - Reference to PApplet.
      sim - Reference to the simulation.
      offset - Unique random value for the tree (-0.05 to 0.05).
      Returns:
      Adjusted final color.
